description:
The second season of Shuumatsu no Valkyrie.

In a shocking turn of events, humanity has won its first battle in the Ragnarök tournament—a series of 13 fights that will decide the fate of mankind. Zeus, the head of gods, sends the demigod Heracles for the next round to avenge the humiliated Greek pantheon. To face this hero loved by gods and humans alike, the Valkyrie Brunhilde decides to use Heracles' complete moral opposite: the infamous serial killer Jack the Ripper—leaving human beings unsure who they should support.

Meanwhile, tensions begin to rise between various divine pantheons, and rumors of a traitor jeopardize the unity of those who want to annihilate humanity. As the line between friend and foe becomes blurred, Brunhilde will do everything she can to make her machinations successful.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Death Game
tags.description: Features characters participating in a game, where failure results in death.

tags.name: Afterlife
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the afterlife.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Sumo
tags.description: Centers around the sport of sumo.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Full CGI
tags.description: Almost entirely created with computer-generated imagery.

node.description:
A mangaka unit. Notable staff: 
- Aji (あじ)
- [Chika Katou](https://anilist.co/staff/234935/) (カトウチカ)
- [Subaru Fuji](https://anilist.co/staff/120119/) (富士昴)
- Hara (原)

__Label:__ Warner Music Japan (since June 2020)
__Office:__ Victor Entertainment
__Genre:__ J-pop, Pop-Rock, Rock
__Instruments:__ Vocal, Guitar

[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC2JzylaIF8qeowc7-5VwwmA) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/373STAFF/) | [Official Website](https://osakana373.therestaurant.jp/) | [Wikipedia (EN)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minami_(singer)) | [Wikipedia (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%BE%8E%E6%B3%A2_(%E3%82%B7%E3%83%B3%E3%82%AC%E3%83%BC%E3%82%BD%E3%83%B3%E3%82%B0%E3%83%A9%E3%82%A4%E3%82%BF%E3%83%BC))

In 2017, she released the first mini album "Emotional Water" and the first single "main actor". It was sold exclusively at Tower Records in Shibuya, Sapporo, Sendai, Nagoya, Osaka, Hiroshima and Fukuoka. In the same year, on August 24, she held her first live at the Shibuya Eggman, titled "Emotional Water ~ my teen finale ~," as she realized her dream of hosting a solo concert in her teens.

In January 2019, she officially debuted featuring her first single "Kawaki wo Ameku", which was used as the opening theme for winter anime "Domestic na Kanojo". Later that year, on spring, with the name "Kawakioameku", she toured for the first time since her debut.
